WRITING.TEXT: They should be called for it even more. Rafa, Murray and Nole especially spend a ridiculous(spellcheck someone) ammount of time getting ready. Disregard my flair but I think that Federer is one of the quickest to get on with it, atleast in the upper ranks of tennis.

Its a choke when you have an advantage and the momentum going your way and the match going to your strenghts but fuck it up anyways.

Lmao virtually no injuries, like that should be an argument. Its not Rogers fault that Rafa has a physical style of play as opposed to his so he gets more injuries, plus Federer has had back and knee injuries and mono to top that off. Dont forget that Rafa doesnt have more than two titles on any GS besides the French when Fed has 7,5,4 on Wimby, US, and AO respectively. More consecutive weeks, more GS finals, semis, and quarters, more total weeks on top, and definitely a more consistent player. And isnt Davis cup a team competition, and the only good player either in singles or doubles to come out of Switzerland is Stan besides Roger. Not discrediting Rafa but i think Rog has the better resume.

Yeah I understand that, every single match was the forehand-to-backhand experience which was only interesting when Federer defied it. Clay was especially boring, but I will always consider it the greatest rivalry of all time even though it scarred me.

There is no ah, you dont see an a anywhere in his name so you dont say it. I mean I hear his name atleast 25 times a day now so trust me on this one.
No, its not. Im from Montenegro, right next to Serbia, we speak the same language and Joh-koh-vich is lot closer than the other pronunciation.

Do flags have to be thrown every play? Of course not. Plays that you can challenge are ended with a decision that has to be made, they have to decide if its a catch or not, first down or not. Flags of course are necessary but dont have to be thrown constantly, however these calls have to be made constantly. I agree that you should be able to challenge plays, just that is unlikely, cause the organization and the refs would hate to be wrong on something they dont necessarily have to be.
